unnormalised: Someone asked me about neurology stuff. Well, neurology basically deals with the brain, spinal cord, and nerves. Think of it as the electrician for your body’s wiring. My friend Priya’s mom, for example, recently had a stroke. She was admitted to AIIMS, Delhi and Dr. Sharma (neurologist) prescribed her some meds, including Aspirin 75mg. It's scary stuff, but neuro docs are there to help.
normalised: Someone asked me about neurology stuff. Well, neurology basically deals with the brain, spinal cord, and nerves. Think of it as the electrician for your body's wiring. My friend Priya's mom, for example, recently had a stroke. She was admitted to A-I-I-M-S, Delhi and Doctor Sharma (neurologist) prescribed her some meds, including Aspirin seventy five milligram. It's scary stuff, but neuro docs are there to help.

unnormalised: Common neuro problems? Migraines are a big one, and so is epilepsy. My uncle has terrible migraines, and he pops Saridon like candy! Also, lots of people get diagnosed with nerve damage, like peripheral neuropathy, especially if they have diabetes. Neurologists run tests like MRIs and EEGs to figure out what's going on. I think the MRI cost around Rs. 8000.
normalised: Common neuro problems? Migraines are a big one, and so is epilepsy. My uncle has terrible migraines, and he pops Saridon like candy! Also, lots of people get diagnosed with nerve damage, like peripheral neuropathy, especially if they have diabetes. Neurologists run tests like M-R-Is and E-E-Gs to figure out what's going on. I think the M-R-I cost around rupee eight thousand.

unnormalised: If you're having weird symptoms, like persistent headaches, numbness, or weakness, don't delay seeing a neurologist. Early diagnosis is key. My neighbour, Mr. Gupta, ignored his tingling fingers for months, and turned out he had carpal tunnel syndrome. He finally got treated at Max Hospital on 15/07/2023. Better safe than sorry, ya know? Get yourself checked.
normalised: If you're having weird symptoms, like persistent headaches, numbness, or weakness, don't delay seeing a neurologist. Early diagnosis is key. My neighbour, Mister Gupta, ignored his tingling fingers for months, and turned out he had carpal tunnel syndrome. He finally got treated at Max Hospital on fifteenth July two thousand and twenty three. Better safe than sorry, ya know? Get yourself checked.
